isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Diesel Engine Diagnostic Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Engine Symptoms Diagnostics - Problems and Conditions - Aerated Fuel

svcprocinfo.para: Fuel aeration will exhibit one or more of the following characteristics:

item.para: Engine stall during operation
White to black smoke during cranking
Rough running engine
Extended engine crank time (hard start)
Fuel pressure slow to build while cranking
Excessive fuel pressure while cranking
Pulsating fuel pressure during crank or engine running at idle.
Difficulty priming fuel system
Leaks in fuel supply to fuel pump
Loose fuel injector hold down
Missing/damaged stainless steel injector gasket
Fuel Pressure Test Gauge
1 to 5 gallon bucket
Fuel pump supply line
Fuel filter housing supply line fitting (Part No. 3533425C2)
Fuel Pressure Test Adapter
Fuel/Oil Pressure Test Coupler

note.para: If directed to this procedure from "Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics" section, go to "Alternate Fuel Source Supply to Fuel Pump" in this section.

caution.para: Be sure to place a rag or suitable container under the fuel pressure test valve when bleeding the fuel rail. Dispose of fuel in a correct container clearly marked DIESEL FUEL according to local regulations.

note.para: Engine fuel can be a threat to the environment. Never dispose of engine fuel by putting it in the trash, pouring on the ground, in the sewers, in streams, or bodies of water.
Engines are equipped with a fuel pressure test valve in the form of either a Shrader valve or a diagnostic coupling.

step1.para: Check fuel pressure and aeration from fuel pressure test valve located at the front of the intake manifold.
Check fuel pressure and aeration from fuel pressure test valve located at the front of the intake manifold.

note.para: If the engine is equipped with a Shrader valve, use the Fuel Pressure Test Adapter.
If the engine is equipped with a diagnostic coupling, adapt the Fuel/Oil Pressure Test Coupler to the Fuel Pressure Gauge.

figure.caption: Fuel Pressure Gauge to fuel pressure test adapter

step1.para: Connect Fuel Pressure Gauge with shut-off valve and clear 3/8" diameter hose to test valve.
Route the clear hose into a drain pan.
Start or crank the engine for 20 seconds. Measure fuel pressure with the shut-off valve closed. Open the shut-off valve to check for aeration.

note.para: Breaking any fuel system joint will induce air into the fuel system. The air should pass in a short period of time. As fuel pressure is relieved, a steady stream of fuel without air bubbles indicates the fuel is not aerated.

item.para: If fuel pressure is in specification and fuel is not aerated, do not continue with this test.
If the fuel is aerated, go to "Alternate Fuel Source Supply to Fuel Pump" in this section.

svcsubproc.title: Alternate Fuel Source Supply to Fuel Pump

item.para: Use spare fuel line. (Make sure the sleeve seal is in good condition.) Cut the line in half. Use the test fuel line portion that supplies the fuel pump. Install clear plastic line in place of removed section and secure plastic line with a clamp.

note.para: The mechanic is expected to keep the fuel test line for future diagnostics. Expense the fuel test line as an essential tool and keep it with other diagnostic tools. Warranty will not cover the cost of the fuel test line.

step1.para: Connect the fuel test line between the fuel pump inlet and an alternate fuel source.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing test line, do not crimp the line, run the line too close to moving parts, or let the line touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Start or crank the engine for 20 seconds. Measure fuel pressure with the shut-off valve closed. Open the shut-off valve to check for aeration.

note.para: Breaking any fuel system joint will induce air into the fuel system. The air should pass in a short period of time. As fuel pressure is relieved, a steady stream of fuel without air bubbles indicates the fuel is not aerated.

item.para: If the fuel is aerated, go to "Combustion Leaks to Fuel" in this section.
If the fuel is not aerated, remove test setup from the fuel pump inlet. Connect the fuel pump supply line. Go to "Alternate Fuel Source Supply to Fuel Filter Housing" in this section.

svcsubproc.title: Alternate Fuel Source Supply to Fuel Filter Housing

step1.para: Disconnect the supply line from the fuel filter housing.

item.para: Use a 90° fuel line male fitting and install a clear plastic line that is long enough to reach an alternative fuel source.

note.para: The mechanic is expected to keep the fuel test line for future diagnostics. Expense the fuel test line as an essential tool and keep it with other diagnostic tools. Warranty will not cover the cost of the fuel test line.

step1.para: Connect the alternate fuel source to the fuel filter housing inlet.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing test line, do not crimp the line, run the line too close to moving parts, or let the line touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Start or crank the engine for 20 seconds. Measure fuel pressure with the shut-off valve closed. Open the shut-off valve to check for aeration.

note.para: Breaking any fuel system joint will induce air into the fuel system. The air should pass in a short period of time. As fuel pressure is relieve, a steady stream of fuel without air bubbles indicates the fuel is not aerated.
If a fuel pressure gauge with shut-off valve and clear 3/8" diameter hose is not available, refer to the alternative test "Checking for Aerated Fuel using Spare Fuel Line."

item.para: If the fuel pressure is in specification and the fuel is not aerated, repair the leak between the fuel filter housing and the fuel tank.
If the fuel is aerated, repair or replace the fuel filter housing.

step1.para: Remove the valve cover following the procedure in the Engine Service Manual.
Check all injector hold-down clamps for correct torque.

Remove any loose injectors. Inspect and clean following the procedure in the Engine Service Manual. Replace injector O-rings and install injectors following the procedure in the Engine Service Manual.
Test for fuel aeration to validate the repair. Go to "Aerated Fuel Inspection" in this section.
